net.tinyos.prowler

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tinyos.prowler.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the heart of Prowler, as this is the event based scheduler, or simulator.
    Author:
    Gyorgy Balogh, Miklos Maroti, Gabor Pap (gabor.pap@vanderbilt.edu)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Simulator.PriorityQueue
      As the simulator is event based there is a need for a queue to handle the occurring events.

    • Field Detail

      • random

        public static java.util.Random random

      • ONE_SECOND

        public static final int ONE_SECOND
        This defines the time resolution. Every time and time interval in the simulator is represented in this resolution. This rate corresponds to the 38.4 kbps speed, but maybe a little friendlier.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • firstNode

        public Node firstNode
        The nodes of the Simulator are linked together in a single linked list. This points to the first, and then Node.nextNode to the next.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator()

    • Method Detail

      • setSeed

        public static void setSeed(int seed)

      • getSimulationTime

        public long getSimulationTime()
        Returns:
        Returns the time of the last event in 1/Simulator.ONE_SECOND

      • endOfSimulation

        public boolean endOfSimulation()

      • getSimulationTimeInMillisec

        public long getSimulationTimeInMillisec()
        Returns:
        Returns the time of the last event in milliseconds.

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(Event e)
        Adds an event to the event queue.
        Parameters:
        e - the event to be added to the queue

      • step

        public void step()
        Processes and executes the next event.

      • step

        public void step(int n)
        Processes and executes the next "n" event.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of events to be processed

      • run

        public void run(double timeInSec)
        Runs the simulation for a given amount of time.
        Parameters:
        timeInSec - the time in seconds until the simulation is to run

      • runWithDisplay

        public void runWithDisplay()
        This function runs the simulation with the display. The user of the simulator must first add all the nodes used in the experiment!

      • runWithDisplayInRealTime

        public void runWithDisplayInRealTime()
        This function runs the simulation with the display and in real time. The user of the simulator must first add all the nodes used in the experiment!

      • display

        public void display(Display disp)
        Called by the Display whenever it is repainted, it calls the Node.display(net.tinyos.prowler.Display) method on every nodes in its Node list.
        Parameters:
        disp - the Display on which to draw Nodes

      • addNode

        public void addNode(Node node)
        Adds a single Node to the simulator.
        Parameters:
        app - the Node to be added

      • addNodes

        public void addNodes(java.util.List nodes)
        Adds a List of nodes to the experiment. WARNING: Please call RadioModel.updateNeighborhoods() after you added all nodes to the system.
        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to be added

      • createNode

        public Node createNode(java.lang.Class nodeClass,
              RadioModel radioModel,
              int nodeId,
              double x,
              double y,
              double z)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a node in the simulator at the given position with the given id. WARNING: Please call RadioModel.updateNeighborhoods() after you added all nodes to the system.
        Parameters:
        nodeClass - the class of motes we want to use during the experiment
        radioModel - the radioModel to use
        nodeId - the id of the node
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        z - the z coordinate
        Returns:
        returns the node created
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws various exceptions due to the generic way of constructing the classes

      • createNodes

        public Node createNodes(java.lang.Class nodeClass,
               RadioModel radioModel,
               int startNodeId,
               int nodeNum,
               double areaWidth,
               double maxElevation)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a given number of motes dispersed randomly over a given square area. WARNING: Please call RadioModel.updateNeighborhoods() after you added all nodes to the system.
        Parameters:
        nodeClass - the class of motes we want to use during the experiment
        radioModel - the radioModel to use
        startNodeId - the first node id of the created nodes
        nodeNum - the number of motes
        areaWidth - the size of one side of the square shaped area
        maxElevation - the maximum node elevation (z coordinate)
        Returns:
        returns a reference to the first node in the simulator
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws various exceptions due to the generic way of constructing the classes

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the List of nodes and empties the event queue.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clears the eventQueue. All the nodes remain in the simulator.

      • getFirstNode

        public Node getFirstNode()
        Returns:
        returns the first Node in the simulator's linked list
